body:
ElementsKind lattice and helpers in objects/elements-kind.h:
- enum ElementsKind lists all elements representations, including fast SMI/OBJECT/DOUBLE, HOLEY variants, nonextensible/sealed/frozen (and shared array) kinds, DICTIONARY, sloppy-arguments, string-wrapper kinds, and typed arrays (including RAB/GSAB variants). Constants FIRST/LAST_* cover ranges, and helpers identify categories.
- Helpers for classification:
  • IsFastElementsKind, IsSmiElementsKind, IsObjectElementsKind, IsDoubleElementsKind, IsHoleyElementsKind(ForRead), IsFastPackedElementsKind, IsDictionaryElementsKind, IsTypedArrayElementsKind, IsRabGsabTypedArrayElementsKind, IsTypedArrayOrRabGsabTypedArrayElementsKind, IsAnyNonextensibleElementsKind etc.
  • GetHoleyElementsKind/GetPackedElementsKind; FastSmiToObjectElementsKind; IsSimpleMapChangeTransition; IsMoreGeneralElementsKindTransition; GetMoreGeneralElementsKind; UnionElementsKind helpers; GetCorrespondingRabGsabElementsKind/NonRabGsab.
  • ElementsKindToShiftSize/ByteSize to compute element size.
Usage in KeyedLoadIC handlers depends on these helpers to decide transitions and to select the correct load instructions in AccessorAssembler::EmitElementLoad and in IC::LoadElementHandler.
explanation: Defines the core elements-kind lattice and predicates used to switch fast paths and reason about transitions and holey vs packed behavior for element loads.
file_line: objects/elements-kind.h: all throughout (classification helpers and constants)
